title: TelegramR - vignette

code: # installing devtools install.packages("devtools") # installing telegramR devtools::install_github("SoaresAlisson/telegramR")

title: TelegramR - vignette
code: # if remote package is installed, load it; If not, install if (!require('remotes')) install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github('SoaresAlisson/telegramR')

what: Installation: Option 3 download the files and build it locally
title: TelegramR - vignette
text: go Github, click green bottom <> code, Download Zip, unzip , open .Rproj Rstudio. project loaded, can build package: option1) press ctrl+shift+b, 2) go Build/Install Package

title: TelegramR - vignette
text: installed, load package: need exported data Telegram. Generally, “Downloads/Telegram Desktop/” transform one .HTML file tibble/dataframe, use function html2df("html_file") get messages HTML master folder (usually /Downloads/Telegram Desktop/) transform one single tibble, use dir2df. function parameter recursive = TRUE default, possible recursively find HTML files folders inside another folders. allows user organize chats/channels per name folders subfolders. don’t want , use parameter recursive = FALSE.
code: library(telegramR) # html2df("~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport_2023-12-16 (1)/messages.html") html2df("../data/ChatExport_2023-03-17/messages.html" ) #> # A tibble: 129 × 6 #>    Chat_Name   msg_Id date_time           user_name   text     Audio_Video_image #>    <chr>       <chr>  <dttm>              <chr>       <chr>    <chr>             #>  1 Hacker News 176189 2024-03-01 03:28:54 Hacker News "Scient… NA                #>  2 Hacker News 176190 2024-03-01 04:03:54 Hacker News "NIST R… NA                #>  3 Hacker News 176191 2024-03-01 04:43:54 Hacker News "Positi… NA                #>  4 Hacker News 176192 2024-03-01 04:57:08 NA          "Show H… NA                #>  5 Hacker News 176193 2024-03-01 05:08:54 NA          "Overwh… NA                #>  6 Hacker News 176194 2024-03-01 05:33:54 Hacker News "Docusi… NA                #>  7 Hacker News 176195 2024-03-01 05:43:54 NA          "Nokia … NA                #>  8 Hacker News 176196 2024-03-01 06:03:54 Hacker News "The \"… NA                #>  9 Hacker News 176197 2024-03-01 06:20:41 Hacker News "The Tr… NA                #> 10 Hacker News 176198 2024-03-01 06:38:54 Hacker News "Google… NA                #> # ℹ 119 more rows dirTelegram <- "~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/" dir2df(dirTelegram) #> # A tibble: 929 × 6 #>    Chat_Name   msg_Id date_time           user_name   text     Audio_Video_image #>    <chr>       <chr>  <dttm>              <chr>       <chr>    <chr>             #>  1 Hacker News 176189 2024-03-01 03:28:54 Hacker News "Scient… NA                #>  2 Hacker News 176190 2024-03-01 04:03:54 Hacker News "NIST R… NA                #>  3 Hacker News 176191 2024-03-01 04:43:54 Hacker News "Positi… NA                #>  4 Hacker News 176192 2024-03-01 04:57:08 NA          "Show H… NA                #>  5 Hacker News 176193 2024-03-01 05:08:54 NA          "Overwh… NA                #>  6 Hacker News 176194 2024-03-01 05:33:54 Hacker News "Docusi… NA                #>  7 Hacker News 176195 2024-03-01 05:43:54 NA          "Nokia … NA                #>  8 Hacker News 176196 2024-03-01 06:03:54 Hacker News "The \"… NA                #>  9 Hacker News 176197 2024-03-01 06:20:41 Hacker News "The Tr… NA                #> 10 Hacker News 176198 2024-03-01 06:38:54 Hacker News "Google… NA                #> # ℹ 919 more rows # Counting the messages per chat_name: dplyr::count(dirTelegramDF, Chat_Name) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   Chat_Name                            n #>   <chr>                            <int> #> 1 Hacker News                        129 #> 2 Science News Facts Updates Daily   800 dir2df(dirTelegram, recursive = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 0 × 0

title: TelegramR - vignette
text: Telegram Desktop allows user export channel/chats specific date ranges. exports lot telegram channels/chats, probability become lost high. confusion may happens lot groups/channels, channel exported several times different date ranges. organize , function tm_info() (telegram information) returns name channel/chat, first last dates HTML file way, want export chat, easy know last date last export. make even easier: pay attention export chat/channel least twice, time gap , function filter_last_export identify gap.
code: info_all_tm_chats <- tm_info("~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/") #> Warning in min.default(structure(numeric(0), class = "Date"), na.rm = FALSE): #> no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning in max.default(structure(numeric(0), class = "Date"), na.rm = FALSE): #> no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning in min.default(structure(numeric(0), class = "Date"), na.rm = FALSE): #> no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning in max.default(structure(numeric(0), class = "Date"), na.rm = FALSE): #> no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf info_all_tm_chats #> # A tibble: 209 × 5 #>    HTMLName                                 name  UserPics FirstDate  LastDate   #>    <chr>                                    <chr> <chr>    <date>     <date>     #>  1 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-01-04 2017-01-23 #>  2 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-01-23 2017-02-09 #>  3 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-02-09 2017-02-26 #>  4 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-02-26 2017-03-15 #>  5 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-03-15 2017-04-01 #>  6 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-04-01 2017-04-18 #>  7 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-04-18 2017-05-05 #>  8 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-05-05 2017-05-23 #>  9 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-05-23 2017-06-10 #> 10 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-06-10 2017-06-27 #> # ℹ 199 more rows filter_last_export(info_all_tm_chats) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   name                             LastDate   #>   <chr>                            <date>     #> 1 Hacker News                      2023-12-16 #> 2 Science News Facts Updates Daily 2023-12-19

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alisson Soares. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Soares (2024). telegramR: deal exported chats/channels Telegram. R package version 0.1.0, https://soaresalisson.github.io/telegramR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {telegramR: deal with exported chats/channels from Telegram},   author = {Alisson Soares},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://soaresalisson.github.io/telegramR/}, }

title: deal with exported chats/channels from Telegram
text: R package telegramR package deals exported chats Telegram messenger. Telegram desktop allows user export data chats channels, extract ant treat data remains question. package allows transformation HTML exported chats/channels tibble/dataframe, well functions brief summary exported chats.

title: deal with exported chats/channels from Telegram
text: install package using devtools
code: # installing devtools install.packages("devtools") # installing telegramR devtools::install_github("SoaresAlisson/telegramR")

title: deal with exported chats/channels from Telegram
code: # if remote package is installed, load it; If not, install if (!require('remotes')) install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github('SoaresAlisson/telegramR')

title: deal with exported chats/channels from Telegram

title: deal with exported chats/channels from Telegram
text: Telegram Desktop allows user export channel/chats specific date ranges. exports lot telegram channels/chats, probability become lost high. confusion may happens lot groups/channels, channel exported several times different date ranges. organize , function tm_info() (telegram information) returns name channel/chat, first last dates HTML file way, want export chat, easy know last date last export. make even easier:
code: info_all_tm_chats <- tm_info("~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/") info_all_tm_chats #> # A tibble: 209 × 5 #>    HTMLName                                 name  UserPics FirstDate  LastDate   #>    <chr>                                    <chr> <chr>    <date>     <date>     #>  1 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-01-04 2017-01-23 #>  2 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-01-23 2017-02-09 #>  3 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-02-09 2017-02-26 #>  4 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-02-26 2017-03-15 #>  5 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-03-15 2017-04-01 #>  6 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-04-01 2017-04-18 #>  7 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-04-18 2017-05-05 #>  8 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-05-05 2017-05-23 #>  9 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-05-23 2017-06-10 #> 10 ~/Downloads/Telegram Desktop/ChatExport… Hack… ""       2017-06-10 2017-06-27 #> # ℹ 199 more rows filter_last_export(info_all_tm_chats) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   name                             LastDate   #>   <chr>                            <date>     #> 1 Hacker News                      2023-12-16 #> 2 Science News Facts Updates Daily 2023-12-19

title: Just a wrapper around glue::glue(), For Internal usage. — F
code: F(   ...,   .sep = "",   .envir = parent.frame(),   .open = "{",   .close = "}",   .na = "NA",   .null = character(),   .comment = "#",   .literal = FALSE,   .transformer = identity_transformer,   .trim = TRUE )

title: wrapper around gsub(). For Internal usage. — gsub2
text: text CHAR. text substituted arg1 CHAR. argument substituted ic BOOLEAN. ignore case. Default = TRUE arg2 CHAR. argument substitution

title: wrapper around gsub(). For Internal usage. — gsub2
text: wrapper around gsub, order make usable native pipe `|>`

title: wrapper around gsub(). For Internal usage. — gsub2
code: "foo foo FOO bar bar" |> gsub2("foo", "fool") #> Error in gsub2("foo foo FOO bar bar", "foo", "fool"): could not find function "gsub2"
